## Exercise 4

```{r}
z=(1:25)
a=z*0
b=z^2
d=seq(0,1,length.out=25)
e=log(z)
set.seed(1337)                  
y  = 2 * a + b / 4 + 8 * d - 3 * e + rnorm(25, 0 , 1)
(y)
```

```{r}
a1=(41:17)
a=a1+(1:25)
y2  = 2 * a + b / 4 + 8 * d - 3 * e + rnorm(25, 0 , 1)
(y2)
```

```{r}
set.seed(1337)                  
y3  = 2 * a + b / 4 + 8 * d - 3 * e + rnorm(25, 0 , 1)
(y3)
```

The number generated by RNG in R is not random. With set.seed we can make sure generating the same *random vector* if we run the code for multiple times. Otherwise, we will get a different vector (and a different `y` consequently) each time we run the code.

```{r}
f=paste(letters[1:26])
g=paste0(f,b)     #`b` changed from numeric vector to character vector
```

```{r}
dummy=y>10
summary(dummy)
```

`18` elements are greater than `10` in `y`

## Exercise 5

```{r}
n=(1:100)
((-1)^(2*n+1))
((-1)^(2*n))
```

All the elements in $(-1)^(2*n+1)$ are `-1`, while all the elements in $(-1)^(2*n)$ are `1`.

```{r}
n1=(2:100)
(sum(cos(n1*pi)/sqrt(n)))
(sum(((-1)^(n1+1))/n))
(sum(((((-1)^(2*n))*n)/((n^2)+5))))
```
